intro: Seseli corsicum, commonly known as Corsican seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Corsica. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
